#summary A brief tutorial for new CUDA programmers

= Introduction =

This page describes how to get started programming in CUDA C/C++, a language for programming massively parallel GPUs.  This tutorial is intended for an audience experienced in C or C++ programming.

= Prerequisites =

To get started programming with CUDA, download and install the [www.nvidia.com/getcuda CUDA Toolkit and developer driver].  The toolkit contains `nvcc`, the NVIDIA CUDA Compiler, and other tools necessary to develop CUDA applications. To execute CUDA programs, you'll also need a [http://www.nvidia.com/object/cuda_gpus.html CUDA-compatible GPU].
